selectedVerses.text: The fallow ground of the poor would yield much food, but it is swept away through injustice.
But if you still do wickedly, you shall be swept away, both you and your king."
His tail swept down a third of the stars of heaven and cast them to the earth. And the dragon stood before the woman who was about to give birth, so that when she bore her child he might devour it.
The torrent Kishon swept them away, the ancient torrent, the torrent Kishon. March on, my soul, with might!
And when it comes, it finds the house swept and put in order.
